p: We were glad for your letters, as always; and it's dear of you to plan for us as you've been doing. We could not feel right about being with you for more than a brief visit if your actual household expenses were increased. The household budget would have to stay the same, or we wouldnt stay. There would still be the debt of kindness, which could be paid only with kindness.
Enat, I have not been helping Sig, except by paying $20 commission on the Denver trip, which cleared me $230 even so; and $5 on the Taylor business. Sig & Max have written
a great many letters for me, and I felt they should have some commission on the engagements landed. They did not ask it.

As for Hiddy, I don't think she has been milked. I have paid Alice's lessons in advance to March 1st, and have been & am giving her $10 a month for incidental expenses. Her board cannot be much and Hiddy's total household expense under the present arrangement is little more than if she were alone. She has been able to pay off the debt she incurred while alone.
Something is brewing that may turn out very well for me. It looks good, as there is influence in high places on my side. I'll tell about it later.
As for finishing my Cycle. Anyone who wouldn't do so in the same position of advantage would be a silly ass, obviously.

Ollie, I'm grateful for the inquiries you made. I'm afraid it's a muddle-headed affair; but just on the off-chance, I'd be glad if you'd inquire at Jeff City, just as a good citizen grown curious. Will you? Then, with any-chance appearing, I might tackle the Washington gentlemen and get a rise out of him.
Anyway, we may be running up to see all of you'ns this month.
